title: Does reading books really change you as a person? - Quora

response.answer_text: Simple answer, YES! I never read a whole book throughout my school years. I thought books were boring and they were useless - i would rather watch a movie! The best thing about book reading is how far and wild your imagination can go. Once you realise what you enjoy, you find a book about it and you can re-live that enjoyment everyday! I am your average 29 year old who is about to get married and love dogs and hiking … but my favourite thing in the WORLD to read is Italian mafia books. I have a whole bookshelf dedicated to John Gotti, Sammy “the bull” Gravano, Richard “the ice man” Kuklinksi .. but on the other side of my bookshelf, i also have really random genres like horror, romance, autobiographies and self-help that i have enjoyed reading time and time again. The upside to reading is that if you REALLY enjoy the book, you will not want to put it down. You get lost in the book and your imagination runs wild pending how descriptive the book it. There have been books that are 500+ pages that i read in a week because i couldn’t wait to make some free time just to read. From a change perspective, it opens your mind to see things differently in life. The mafia books interest me because you see life through the eyes of someone else in a time where you weren’t around. Italian mafia “big boys” span from 1920’s through to the 1990’s (and now too perhaps but the big boys i enjoyed reading about & movies were made about are now long gone) Books about romance make you appreciate your loved one for the things they do for you, no matter how small they are. Horror books open your eyes to the realisation that some of this stuff could only happen in a book or a movie and never in reality. Self-help books? Well they speak for themselves. My absolute favourite is “the subtle art of not giving a f*ck” by Mark Manson. Self-help books assist the realisation of your true potential in life, employment, love life and family. In short - reading is the bomb-diggity!

Yes, reading can change you as a person, provided you are interested in reading. Reading lets you understand the author's perspective and takes you through their world of thoughts. You can literally be in another world while reading! Personally, I prefer reading nonfiction to fiction. Specifically, memoirs, autobiographies and philosophy genres. It generally provides me a lot of insights about life and creativity. Therefore, if you are a beginner to reading, first find the genre of your interest and read at least a few fixed number of pages every day. You can slowly notice the changes it brings in you with time (Of course consistency is the key for observing these changes).

Yes… Books can your very good friend if you enjoy reading or listening them (in audiobooks). There are different genre of books depending on your interest zone which will definitely uplift your mindset, be it motivational books, life skills, psychological books, or fictional, you will find them relatable as if you are talking to a friend of yours. In return, book will answer you with its awesome collections of suggestions, inspirations and with a lots of experiences. So, its basically a good source of amusement along with learning which enables you to enjoy your solitude as well as fills you with lots of knowledge and wisdom!

Just reading books will not help you to change yourself. Reading books help you to realise so many things you might not aware of those things. For example a person who always talk negative in life and who see the flaws in other may get some idea from the books that how this attitude affects life of person negatively but most of times people learn these things from books but don't apply in real life which does not change person. So reading book won't help you untill unless you apply those things in your life. Even not just about book, your life won't change untill you are willing to change through actions. Small actions are much better than having bigger plans/thought s without actions.

Reading helps us understand how other people think and feel Someone who reads more is thus more likely to empathise with fellow humans or animals as he/she is able to quickly flow into a third person's perspective in order to see a situation through a different pair of eyes

It can. Just as having a guidebook or map can change the course of a trip—you might just take a turn off the freeway because something caught your attention, and all of a sudden you are on your way to an entirely new perspective on life.
When one reads a book they are going to find another themselves in them. That I did too at such a young age. That other one of them just might have a greater influence on them and may change them.

It can, but it doesn’t do so necessarily or automatically. It depends on what you read and when you read it. For example, I read a lot of books on existential and psychoanalytic psychotherapy, but only a handful of each were real eye-openers.

Whatever we read, it gets recorded in our subconscious mind. And when we are not active, our sub conscious mind takes over. It gets reflected in our action. So, it is very important what we are feeding to our mind. So reading plays a very pivot role in our life.

Yes of course. What kind of person you want to be depends on the kind of books you read. But reading once and throwing the book will not be effective. Read it again and again to recondition your mind. Select the books carefully.
According to me, It satisfies the thirst of the mind i.e your question s will be answered,it generates new thoughts and provides you with solutions in life.
Reading never changes you, nothing can't! Rather reading helps in shaping your vision, your thoughts the way you see the world around.
